page.title: 20Supernatural /Superstition
page.content: Two people believed in ghosts; in one house two seperate visitors felt a benign presence in one room. On the turnpike road, at a filling station originally a Posthouse, the ghost of a cavalier had been seen-a happy ghost; he and a dog were seen by a daughter on another occasion-these were not local people. When walls were demol- ished in two old farmhouses, an eagle's foot was found-intended to ward off evil spirits. One farmer would never hit a cow with a rowan stick. Many burn ashen faggots at Christmas. Owners of one farm had been told by previous owners not to touch a noose hanging from a beam in the barn, on pain of bad luck; suppos- edly, a 93 year old man had hanged himself after being involved with a young girl-no evidence for it, but they have never touched the rope.
